intro: Mouriri nervosa, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the common starfruit. The plant has simple, alternate leaves with prominent veins, and its flowers are typically white or pink, clustered in small inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. The fruit is edible, with a sweet, juicy pulp that is popular in local cuisines.
